results.title: RAAF Newsreel. No. 9. Operation sabre ferry
results.creator_credit: Harry Rayner and Australia. Royal Australian Air Force
results.brief_description: Newsreel items including: 1. No. 3 Squadron and No. 77 Squadron of the RAAF ferry the Sabre Jet from the east coast of Australia to Butterworth in Malaya via Townsville, Darwin, Netherlands New Guinea, Philippines, Borneo, Malaya. 2. Firefighter - RAAF demonstrates capability of new firefighting truck. 3. Addition of the new Air to Air Missile to the Sabre Jet Fighter. Test fired at Woomera.

results.title: [The Australian outback]
results.brief_description: On a cattle station 200 miles from Oodnadatta, stockmen are shown preparing for a muster, mustering scrub cattle, branding and droving the cattle to the trucking yards.

results.title: Drought feeding
results.brief_description: Discusses the various fuel values of different foodstuffs and gives much information on drought feeding of stock. Based on scientific investigations made by the Australian wool board into the subject of drought feeding of sheep, this film shows the fuel value of various types of supplementary fodder, taking into account both cost and nutritive value. The Wool Board makes available to pastoralists a Drought Feed Calculator, together with other tables relating to drought feeding, are clearly presented in this film.

results.title: Tour of Tasmania, February 1950
results.brief_description: Home movie travelogue of Tasmania shot in February 1950. Includes scenes of several historic buildings and sites, and of Swansea, Port Arthur, Hobart and Cataract Gorge. No credits available.

results.title: By Lake and Stream
results.creator_credit: Jack Keane and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: An account of the work being done to maintain the trout population of Victorian lakes and streams. Shows the initial trapping of adult fish, stripping of eggs from the female fish, and subsequent hatching of young fry at the Snob’s Creek hatchery, keeping the young fish in brooding ponds, and finally the release of the trout to replenish lakes and streams. Various trout fishing techniques are demonstrated, and the film concludes with scenes of anglers in action in many parts of the State.

results.title: Men in wool
results.creator_credit: Frank Land and Australian Wool Corporation
results.brief_description: Designed to show the importance of wool in the manufacture of men’s clothing, tracking the cycle from the shearing shed to the tailored suit. Illustrates the process of shearing, grading, scouring and carding and explains the range of tests for strength, elasticity and possible imperfections. Finally shows the manufacture of a suit using mass productions and hand tailoring techniques. Photographed by George Heath; narrated by Michael Charlton; edited by Les Wasley; script by John Moyes Junior; sound by Allyn Barnes.

results.title: Wandering Thru' the Centre
results.brief_description:
A travel film through the centre of Australia. Features the Flying Doctor’s Base at Alice Springs, The Devil’s Marble near Wanchop, Darwin beach and harbour and many other tourist delights to be found en route from Alice Springs to Darwin.

Digitising Technician Note: Film contains footage of the making of “The Overlanders” (1946). Noted by Ben Abbott 09/01/2018

results.title: Royal visit to Melbourne 1963 [Work print]
results.creator_credit: H. Rodney Power, David Swift and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: Work print footage of the royal visit in 1963. Includes aerial views of Melbourne, the arrival of the royal yacht, The Queen and Price Phillip being greeted by dignitaries, the inspection of troops, passing crowds in a Rolls Royce, the arrival at a racetrack and a reception at the Melbourne Town Hall

results.title: Bushfire: our summer fate
results.brief_description: Shows how a bushfire in the Blue Mountains on 6 December 1977 caused the death of one person, 70 homes to be destroyed and the evacuation of thousands all in a space of five hours and similarly how the bushfire of summer 1967 in Hobart killed 62 people and destroyed upto 1000 homes and 130 major buildings. Includes a report by scientist David Ellyards on how, where and why bushfires start in Australia followed up by how to prevent death and destruction due to bushfires.

results.title: Lease of life
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: Presents the Victorian Cancer Institute’s 4MeV linear accelerator. An important weapon against cancer, it is used for deep X-ray therapy. Traces a case history of a woman who is eventually restored to her family by the special treatment made possible by the accelerator. Narrated by Marcia Hart. Filmed at the Peter MacCallum Cancer Institute in Melbourne, Victoria.
